title: Can we get a 'Sustain' rework? Esp for Sustain Tanks?
body:
EC just makes sustain focused champs (swain, mundo) so garbage... and EC is in the game because you haven't devoted the resources to balancing sustain yet.
So... Do it plz rito?

replies.body: EC exists because riot believes that "heals are anti-fun".

Problem is how do you rework it to fulfill its fantasy when the fantasy itself can be frustrating from a gameplay perspective?

I think Warwick does it well. His sustain doesn't activate until he's a half health and he has another way to mitigate damage.

It could be done with more windowed sustain. Mundo's uult, for instance, is very strong sustain, but doesn't _feel_ super unfair because, well, it's his ult and it's only for a short time. Or how a lot of Vlad's healing got moved to his empowered Q, which is only available for a few seconds.

every fantasy, if it is good, will be frustrating from a gameplay perspective. Because every fantasy worth it's salt is about shitting over the other guy. 

the way you do this is by providing a reasonable set of circumstances where you will be made to fail.
Ok, so how to you provide the circumstances to fail outside of buying GW?

Drain tanking is essentially a form of being tanky when you are attacking, and is characterized by a gradual increase in HP.

the answer is generally, to either burst the character or not allow him to attack when his capacity to drain tank is available. 

with that thought here are some answers:
1. the character is very squishy and can't build tank and doesn't have trump cards against death so you can just burst it and kill it within the span of a single CC chain (ADC case).
2. the character only has drain tanking available for a short, telegraphed duration. At which point it can be kited at that duration (trundle case).
3. the character can only drain tank when it is specifically vulnerable to a form of attack that circumvents drain tanking (Warwick case). 

characters that can consistently drain tank so long as they are in range of whatever they use to drain tank are a problem, because a lot of low damage champions exist that can only function inside those ranges. if you are playing a champion who's major strength is "close range sustained melee attacking", a "as long as we exchange AAs, i delete you damage" champion is a hard counter.

the problem with drain tanking is {{item:1053}} .

drain tanking should be a champion ability. not an item. (notably, this is less of a problem than it used to be)

i used to think this way and then there was this other guy on the forums who wrote a great argument in favor of vamp scepter.

specifically, that it allows champions to have the hp required to 1v1, whilst being vulnerable to burst. 

so i think the problem is not simply in fight sustain existing, but rather in some cases the amount of it.

The issue is it sometimes makes burst the only way you can kill them.  It's especially annoying when a mage can't kill them in one rotation, and they just heal back to full before any of your spells are back off cooldown.

That's either a question of situational strength (protected ADC or unprotected ADC) or game-stage strength (early game ADC or later game ADC). 

The question is therefore: should you be able to kill a protected ADC? should you be able to kill a late game ADC?

I am not sure of the answers, but there certainly is a case that at the late game (this is when the ADC has this kind of LS), the ADC is supposed to kill the mage / assassin, rather than the other way around.

Your argument is inherently flawed: "should you be able to kill a protected adc?"--when you say "protected adc" you are probably refering to one that is being protected by his/her allies. this means you are fighting more than just the adc (obviously) and you need to account for that 1v2, 2v2, etc situation.
Asking if you should be able able to kill a protected adc is the same as asking if you should be able to win a fight vs multiple opponents. (if they have allies you may want to bring some too, etc.)

early game vs late game champions may exist, but the fact remains that (due to immense lifesteal and other low-cost defenses) many marksmen and other champions can enter a fight, take constant damage during that fight, and walk away with more health than they started with.

my initial post was mildly exagerated, but the fact remains that Lifesteal is a form of defense, and given that 'adc' is steriotypically a "offense only" position, that defense (as well as others--the others are actually larger offenders right now) is coming to them far more cheaply than it should.
Riot needs to remove sustain from items that are not support/health regen based

Well, they are.  For the same reason assassins are.

Either they are enough to matter, in which case they are oppressive, or they aren't in which case they are useless.

In all PVP games, this will be an issue.  The only way to balance assassins, or serious healers (self or others), is to not have them.  Because they will never, ever, be anything but "anti-fun" for someone.  Whether that's the player, or their opponent.

The problem with using PVE character fantasies, is that some of them don't port well to PVP.

Thing is, we're stuck with both, and both will cause problems.  In this case, Riot seems comfortable mostly ignoring stuff.

The problem with grievous wounds is that it's completely passive for physical damage dealers.

For mages, {{item:3165}} adds another aspect of threat - when they get you low, they also cut out some of the tools you might use to survive. It helps them seal a kill. For the physical damage dealers, it's just a flat "you don't get to heal when you fight me."

You can change how you play (leave early, blow heal items and abilities early, use summoners, etc.) to work around the mage GW applicator. You can't do any of that for the physical damage one... and physical damage dealers aren't "whittle them down slowly" any more; they burst just as hard as the mages do.

I understand wanting to have a way to counter healing, especially self-healing, because it can feel super sucky to fight somebody that you just can't do lasting damage to. But it also feels like absolute garbage to be a champion that relies on healing ({{champion:36}}, {{champion:16}}, etc.) to just get a third of your output nixed by an 800g item that you can't work around in any way, shape, or form.
